newsitem.title: USA: AlliedSignal chairman seeks weaker dollar.
newsitem.headline: AlliedSignal chairman seeks weaker dollar.

text.p: AlliedSignal Inc chairman and chief executive officer Lawrence Bossidy said Thursday he would like to see a weaker dollar at around 100 to 110 yen.
"I'd like to see it weaken, that is to say the dollar against the yen," Bossidy said on CNBC business television.

Bossidy, who is also chairman of the Business Council, said he would convey his views to Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin when he addressed a closed meeting of the council in Williamsburg, Va., on Friday morning.
"I have said publicly I'd like to see the dollar somewhere between 100 and 110 yen. I think that makes competition more evenly balanced."
He said he'd given Rubin his views before and "I'll remind him again tomorrow. I don't think he always listens."
The dollar closed in New York Thursday at 123.62/72 yen.
